task: Making Moist Fluffy Chocolate Chip Muffins with a Bakery-Style Dome

steps.details: Set the oven to 425 degrees Fahrenheit for an initial high heat blast.

details: Measure 330 grams (2 3/4 cups) of all-purpose flour.
Add 1 teaspoon of salt and 1 tablespoon of baking powder.
Sift the dry ingredients together and whisk briefly.
Melt 113 grams (1/2 cup) of unsalted butter and let it cool slightly.
Combine 300 ml (1 1/4 cups) of whole milk with the melted butter.
Add 200 grams (1 cup) of sugar and whisk until well combined.
Mix in 2 large eggs, 1/4 cup of sour cream (or full-fat plain yogurt), and 1 tablespoon of vanilla extract.

steps.details: Pour the wet mixture into the dry ingredients and whisk until nearly combined, leaving some flour clumps.

details: Mix in 1 1/2 cups of chocolate chips (1 cup semi-sweet and 1/2 cup bittersweet).
Reserve a handful of chocolate chips for topping.
Butter and flour half of the muffin tins.
Use muffin papers for the remaining half.
Use a large ice cream scoop to fill each muffin tin to the brim.
Ensure an even distribution of chocolate chips in each muffin.

steps.details: Sprinkle reserved chocolate chips on top of the filled muffin batter.

details: Bake at 425 degrees Fahrenheit for 5 minutes.
Reduce temperature to 350 degrees Fahrenheit and bake for an additional 20-25 minutes until golden and set.
Allow muffins to cool slightly before removing from the tins.
Observe the difference between muffins baked with and without paper liners.

task: Making Moist Fluffy Muffins with Bakery-Style Dome

details: Set the oven to 425 degrees Fahrenheit for an initial high heat blast (for chocolate chip muffins).
For blueberry muffins, preheat the oven to 350 degrees Fahrenheit.
For chocolate chip muffins: Measure 330 grams (2 3/4 cups) of all-purpose flour, add 1 teaspoon of salt and 1 tablespoon of baking powder, sift and whisk briefly.

For blueberry muffins: Combine 2 cups of all-purpose flour, 1 teaspoon of baking powder, 1/2 teaspoon of baking soda, and 1/4 teaspoon of salt. Reserve 1 tablespoon of this mixture and mix it with 1 1/2 cups of fresh blueberries.

For chocolate chip muffins: Melt 113 grams (1/2 cup) of unsalted butter, combine with 300 ml (1 1/4 cups) of whole milk, add 200 grams (1 cup) of sugar, 2 large eggs, 1/4 cup of sour cream (or full-fat plain yogurt), and 1 tablespoon of vanilla extract. Whisk until well combined.

For blueberry muffins: Beat 3 eggs on high speed for about 3 minutes until fluffy and pale. Slowly add 1 cup of granulated sugar, continuing to beat for 3 more minutes. Add 1 teaspoon of vanilla extract, 1 tablespoon of fresh lemon juice, and 3/4 cups of heavy cream, beating continuously.
For chocolate chip muffins: Pour the wet mixture into the dry ingredients and whisk until nearly combined, leaving some flour clumps.

For blueberry muffins: Gradually add the dry ingredients to the wet mixture using a sifter, mixing in between additions. Once combined, slowly add 4 tablespoons of melted unsalted butter while continuing to beat.
For chocolate chip muffins: Mix in 1 1/2 cups of chocolate chips (1 cup semi-sweet and 1/2 cup bittersweet), reserving a handful for topping.
For blueberry muffins: Fold in the flour-coated blueberries with a spatula.
For chocolate chip muffins: Butter and flour half of the muffin tins, use muffin papers for the remaining half.
For blueberry muffins: Line the muffin tin with cupcake liners.
For chocolate chip muffins: Use a large ice cream scoop to fill each muffin tin to the brim, ensuring an even distribution of chocolate chips.
For blueberry muffins: Scoop the batter into the lined muffin tin using a large cookie scoop. Optionally, top with extra blueberries.

Combine 1 tablespoon of cold cubed unsalted butter, 2 tablespoons of all-purpose flour, a pinch of salt, 1 teaspoon of cinnamon, and 3 tablespoons of brown sugar. Mash together until crumbly and top the muffins with this streusel.

steps.step: Top with Chocolate Chips (For Chocolate Chip Muffins)
steps.details: Sprinkle reserved chocolate chips on top of the filled muffin batter.

details: For chocolate chip muffins: Bake at 425 degrees Fahrenheit for 5 minutes, reduce temperature to 350 degrees Fahrenheit and bake for an additional 20-25 minutes until golden and set.
For blueberry muffins: Bake at 350 degrees Fahrenheit for about 35 minutes.
Allow muffins to cool slightly before removing from the tins.
Observe the difference between muffins baked with and without paper liners.

task: Making Moist Fluffy Muffins with Bakery-Style Dome

details: Set the oven to 425 degrees Fahrenheit for an initial high heat blast (for chocolate chip muffins).
For blueberry muffins, preheat the oven to 350 degrees Fahrenheit.
For the master muffin recipe, start by preheating your oven to 425 degrees Fahrenheit.
For chocolate chip muffins: Butter and flour half of the muffin tins, use muffin papers for the remaining half.
For blueberry muffins: Line the muffin tin with cupcake liners.
Line a 12-cup muffin tin with paper baking cups and give a spritz of nonstick cooking spray on the paper cups for the master muffin recipe.
For chocolate chip muffins: Measure 330 grams (2 3/4 cups) of all-purpose flour, add 1 teaspoon of salt and 1 tablespoon of baking powder, sift and whisk briefly.

For blueberry muffins: Combine 2 cups of all-purpose flour, 1 teaspoon of baking powder, 1/2 teaspoon of baking soda, and 1/4 teaspoon of salt. Reserve 1 tablespoon of this mixture and mix it with 1 1/2 cups of fresh blueberries.
For the master muffin recipe: Combine 2 teaspoons of baking powder, 1/2 teaspoon of salt, and any desired spices like cinnamon or pumpkin pie spice.

For chocolate chip muffins: Melt 113 grams (1/2 cup) of unsalted butter, combine with 300 ml (1 1/4 cups) of whole milk, add 200 grams (1 cup) of sugar, 2 large eggs, 1/4 cup of sour cream (or full-fat plain yogurt), and 1 tablespoon of vanilla extract. Whisk until well combined.

For blueberry muffins: Beat 3 eggs on high speed for about 3 minutes until fluffy and pale. Slowly add 1 cup of granulated sugar, continuing to beat for 3 more minutes. Add 1 teaspoon of vanilla extract, 1 tablespoon of fresh lemon juice, and 3/4 cups of heavy cream, beating continuously.

For the master muffin recipe: Start with 1/2 cup of softened salted butter and 1 cup of granulated sugar, creaming them together using a hand mixer until smooth. Add in 2 large eggs and mix briefly. Incorporate 1 teaspoon of vanilla extract (or other extracts like almond, orange, lemon), and mix in the baking powder and salt mixture.
For chocolate chip muffins: Pour the wet mixture into the dry ingredients and whisk until nearly combined, leaving some flour clumps.

For blueberry muffins: Gradually add the dry ingredients to the wet mixture using a sifter, mixing in between additions. Once combined, slowly add 4 tablespoons of melted unsalted butter while continuing to beat.

For the master muffin recipe: Add half of the 2 cups of all-purpose flour, stir in with a rubber spatula, then add 1/2 cup of milk or buttermilk, stirring until well combined. Finally, add the remaining 1 cup of flour and stir to combine.
For chocolate chip muffins: Mix in 1 1/2 cups of chocolate chips (1 cup semi-sweet and 1/2 cup bittersweet), reserving a handful for topping.
For blueberry muffins: Fold in the flour-coated blueberries with a spatula.

For the master muffin recipe: Add any desired mix-ins like dried fruit, chocolate chips, or berries at this stage. For example, add 1 cup of fresh blueberries and lemon zest for lemon blueberry muffins, or 1 cup of semi-sweet chocolate chips for chocolate muffins.
For chocolate chip muffins: Use a large ice cream scoop to fill each muffin tin to the brim, ensuring an even distribution of chocolate chips.
For blueberry muffins: Scoop the batter into the lined muffin tin using a large cookie scoop. Optionally, top with extra blueberries.
For the master muffin recipe: Divide the batter evenly among 12 muffin cups, filling each about 2/3 full.

For blueberry muffins: Combine 1 tablespoon of cold cubed unsalted butter, 2 tablespoons of all-purpose flour, a pinch of salt, 1 teaspoon of cinnamon, and 3 tablespoons of brown sugar. Mash together until crumbly and top the muffins with this streusel.

For cinnamon muffins: Create a brown sugar streusel with 1/4 cup of cold, cubed butter, 1/2 cup of brown sugar, 1/2 cup of all-purpose flour, and 1/4 teaspoon of ground cinnamon. Sprinkle generously on top of the batter.

steps.step: Top with Chocolate Chips (For Chocolate Chip Muffins)
steps.details: Sprinkle reserved chocolate chips on top of the filled muffin batter.

details: For chocolate chip muffins: Bake at 425 degrees Fahrenheit for 5 minutes, reduce temperature to 350 degrees Fahrenheit and bake for an additional 20-25 minutes until golden and set.
For blueberry muffins: Bake at 350 degrees Fahrenheit for about 35 minutes.
For the master muffin recipe: Bake at 425 degrees Fahrenheit for 7 minutes, then reduce the temperature to 350 degrees Fahrenheit without opening the oven door and continue baking for 12-15 minutes.
Allow muffins to cool slightly before removing from the tins.
Observe the difference between muffins baked with and without paper liners.
